scripts.comment: Some blocks require keys that once obtained the following reporters should be edited to report them.

block.l: To see simple examples using these blocks look at the scripts of the 'Examples' sprite .

block.comment: Click me to clear the Stage.

custom-block.l: A test of the simplest block for text to speech.

custom-block.s: speak %s then %cmdRing with pitch %n with rate %n with voice %n with volume %n in language %txt
custom-block.l: This is a sentence that ends with the number 42.
custom-block.comment: A test of text to speech

custom-block.s: Speak (using Mary TTS) %txt with voice %n at %n volume and then %cmdRing
custom-block.l: This uses a text-to-speech engine in Germany called Mary TTS.

block.comment: A test of the browser's speech recogntion.

custom-block.s: Listen %cmdRing then finally %cmdRing but if error %cmdRing with language %txt with %n maximum alternatives process alternatives %cmdRing and process confidences %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: A full featured speech recognition block. Right click for more help.
Uses another listen block to broadcast listen events.
Takes a photo, sends it to the procider, reports the image labels when the provider responds.
Add a costume of the current photo that was sent for recognition.
Adds a new costume by taking a photo and switching to that costume.

scripts.comment: A different way to do image recognition is to get a recognition response and then get properties from it.

custom-block.comment: Ask an AI cloud service to recognize what the camera is seeing. Reports entire response.
Gets a property of the most recent response from the vision service provider. Below are examples using this block.
Reports the first caption that Microsoft suggested for the most recent recognition.
Reportss the confidence of the labels from the most recent response from the AI vision provider.
Reportss the labels from the most recent response from the AI vision provider.
Overrides the default width and height of camera images

scripts.comment: Another way of doing recognition by providing blocks that will run when the AI cloud provider responds.

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what %txt sees and show the photo %b
custom-block.comment: After vision provider responds runs the blocks with the list of tags. Optionally can also display the photo.

block-definition.s: Listen %'respond as heard' then finally %'handle response' but if nothing heard %'handle nothing said' (requires Microsoft speech key)
block-definition.comment: As speech is recognised 'respond as heard' is called with what it thinks it has heard. 'handle response' is called when it thinks the speaking is finished.

block-definition.s: read URL %'URL' then %'receive contents' or if error %'receive error' using an access key if needed %'key'
block-definition.comment: Reads the contents of 'URL' and then calls 'receive contents' with that text (in HTML). If there was an error 'receive error' is called instead. 'key' needs only be provided if the URL requires as access key.
Must be run before any of the image recognition blocks. Specifies the resolution of the image sent for recogntion.

block-definition.s: Listen %'respond as heard' then finally %'handle response' but if nothing heard %'handle nothing said'
listen for a number %'what to do with the number' %'what to do if not a number'

block.var: what to do with the number
what to do if not a number
what to do if not a number

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.src = "https://toontalk.github.io/ai-cloud/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); return 0; }

block-definition.s: speak %'message' then %'what to do when finished' with pitch %'pitch' with rate %'rate' with voice %'voice' with volume %'volume' in language %'language code'
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide a script to run when finished, the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voices'), volume (a positive number), and language code (a BCP 47 language tag, e.g. en-US).
Stops the current attempt to recognize what is spoken.

block-definition.s: Listen then %'handle response' but if error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

block-definition.s: Ask %'cloud provider' to say what it sees then %'then receive response' and show the picture %'show photo?'
Do %'handle response' with what Google sees and show the photo %'show'
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture and runs script with a list of tags returned by Google. Optionally can show the image.

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.s: Do %'handle response' with what IBM Watson sees and show the photo %'show'
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture and runs script with a list of tags returned by IBM Watson. Optionally can show the image.

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.s: Do %'handle response' with what Microsoft sees and show the photo %'show'
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture and runs script with a list of tags returned by Microsoft. Optionally can show the image.

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.s: IBM Watson image descriptions of new photo
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture, asks IBM Watson to classify it, and reports the response when it arrives.

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what IBM Watson sees and show the photo %b

block-definition.s: Google image descriptions of new photo
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture, asks Google to classify it, and reports the response when it arrives.

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what Google sees and show the photo %b

block-definition.s: Microsoft image descriptions of new photo
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture, asks Microsoft to classify it, and reports the response when it arrives.

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what Microsoft sees and show the photo %b

block-definition.comment: Takes a photo and ask the cloud provider to recognize it. Reports the response when it arrives.

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.s: Current image property from %'cloud provider' get %'property name or names'
block-definition.comment: Reports a property of the most recent recognition by the AI cloud provider. Visit tinyurl.com/snap-ai-docs to learn more.
Reports the confidence scores for the list reported by 'IBM Watson classes'.
Reports a list of tags from IBM Watson from the last time it was asked to recognize an image.
Reports the best caption from the last image recognition that Microsoft did.
Reports the tags from the last image recognition by Google.
Reports the confidence scores of the 'Google labels' from the last image recognition by Google.
Reports the tags of the last image recognition by Microsoft.
Takes a picture, adds it as a costume of the current sprite, and switches to showing the new costume.
Adds the photo taken when the AI cloud provider was last asked to reocognize. Photo is added as a costume of the current sprite.

block-definition.s: Speak (using Mary TTS) %'message' with voice %'voice number' at %'volume' volume and then %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice number'. 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. If provided will run the blocks in 'do when finished' when speech has completed.

block-definition.s: Get Mary TTS voice name %'voice number'
Speak %'message' then %'to do when finished speaking'

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

block-definition.s: Speak with random voice %'message' then %'do when finished'

custom-block.s: speak %s then %cmdRing with pitch %n with rate %n with voice %n with volume %n in language %txt

block-definition.s: Listen %'respond as heard' then finally %'handle final response' but if error %'handle error' with language %'language' with %'max alternatives' maximum alternatives process alternatives %'handle alternatives' and process confidences %'handle confidences'
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'. 'language' can be specified in the format language-dialect, e.g. en-GB. You can ask for a list of alternative responses to what was spoken that contains at most 'max alternatives'. 'handle alternatives' is given a list of alternatives. 'handle confidences' is given a list of numbers between 0 and 1 where 1 is certainty.

block-definition.s: Listen %'respond as heard' then finally %'handle final response' but if error %'handle error'
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'.

When something is spoken this broadcasts 'heard something' and sets 'last thing spoken' to the text that was spoken. You will need to create two new variables for this to work: 'last thing spoken' and 'speech recognition error'.

custom-block.l: I didn't hear anything for a while. Bye. Click the green flag to start listening again.

list.l: . Click the green flag to try again.
. Click the green flag to try again.

block-definition.comment: Reports the labels describing the most recent image recognised by the specified vision service provider.

block-definition.s: Do %'handle response' with what %'provider' sees and show the photo %'show'
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture. When the AI vision provider responds runs the blocks on the labels in the response. Can optionally display the photo.

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.comment: Takes a picture, asks the AI vision cloud provider to classify it, and reports the response when it arrives.

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what %txt sees and show the photo %b

block-definition.comment: Reports the confidence scores for each of the labels described in the vision service provider's most recent response.
